sourcing.instructions: Barium: Purchase from chemical supply companies. Beryllium: Obtain from specialized metal suppliers. Yttrium: Available from rare earth material suppliers. Ensure to follow safety regulations when handling these materials.

1. Wear appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE), including gloves, goggles, and a lab coat. 2. Measure 4.2 g of barium using a precision scale. 3. Measure 0.6 g of beryllium. 4. steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powders to a high-temperature resistant crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace and heat to 1000 째C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure full melting and interaction of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powders to a high-temperature resistant crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace and heat to 1000 째C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure full melting and interaction of the materials.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool slowly to room temperature (approximately 25 째C) over a period of 4 hours. 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled completely to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool slowly to room temperature (approximately 25 째C) over a period of 4 hours. 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled completely to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use a fine-grit sandpaper to smooth out any surface imperfections. 3. If desired, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability and appearance. Allow the sealant to cure according to the manufacturer's instructions.
